byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone reported from New York, and Choe Sang-Hun from Seoul. Gardiner Harris contributed reporting from Washington.
byline.original: By RICK GLADSTONE and CHOE SANG-HUN

abstract: Parents of University of Virginia student Otto F Warmbier, detained in North Korea since January, hope his tearful apology broadcast on state television will prompt his release; have not heard from him since he was arrested during five-day tour of country.
lead_paragraph: In their first comment on the arrest, the parents of Otto F. Warmbier said they hoped North Korea would free him after he admitted stealing a political banner.

headline.main: Parents of American Held in North Korea Unable to Speak With Him
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Asia; North Korea: Parents Hope Apology Will Free Son

snippet: In their first comment on the arrest, the parents of Otto F. Warmbier said they hoped North Korea would free him after he admitted stealing a political banner.
